subject: Productivity
title: Locke and Latham's Five Principles
description: A quick win: understand Locke and Latham's Five Principles.

hook.text: Two researchers spent 25 years studying goals. They found five principles that predict success.

buildup.text: Edwin Locke and Gary Latham published their goal-setting theory after reviewing 400 studies.

discovery.text: The five principles: clarity, challenge, commitment, feedback, and task complexity. All five matter.

twist.text: Most people only know clarity. The other four are equally important but almost never discussed.

climax.text: Their research is the most validated theory in organizational psychology. Goals are science, not wishes.

punchline.text: Five principles. Four hundred studies. Goals are not guesswork.

quiz.question: How many studies did Locke and Latham review for their theory?
